Administrator Documentation and Tools

Version 8.1.0

Tasks & Tools for Administrators

Installing & Configuring DeployR

Learn all about the system requirements, dependencies, and steps to installing DeployR. After installing, carefully follow the configuration steps. More...

Upgrading & Migrating Data

Learn how to upgrade and migrate your data to this version of DeployR. More...

Diagnostic Testing & Troubleshooting

Learn how to run a diagnostic health check of the DeployR environment as well as search for solutions in our troubleshooting topics. More...

Common Administrative Tasks

Learn how to stop and start DeployR, how to back up and restore data, where to find server logs, and how to open ports for DeployR. More...

Repository Manager

This web-based tool serves as a bridge between the data scientist's scripts, models, & data and the deployment of that work into the DeployR repository to enable application developers to create DeployR-powered client applications and integrations. More...

Administration Console

The Administration Console is a tool, delivered as an easy-to-use Web interface, that facilitates the management of users, roles, IP filters, the grid and runtime policies on the DeployR server. More...

R Packagement Management

Learn how to assign the appropriate permissions for packaging installations and/or install the packages for your users to ensure the R code running on DeployR has access to the R package dependencies declared within that code. More...

Advanced Administration Tasks

Security for DeployR

DeployR is a server framework that exposes the R platform as a service to allow the integration of R statistics, analytics, and visualizations inside Web, desktop, and mobile applications. In addition to providing a simple yet powerful Web services API, the framework also supports a highly-flexible, enterprise security model. More...

Manage Database for High Availability

Learn how to manage the database for an increase in overall data availability. This approach is highly recommended for production deployments. More...

Tune Server for High Throughput Workloads

The DeployR server supports a flexible grid architecture that is capable of expanding or contracting server capacity to effectively handle any anticipated workload. Scale out, scale up and manage custom workloads to deliver the throughput you need. More...

Managing External Directories for Big Data

Whenever data is too big to be stored out on the Web or on a user’s machine, those files can be stored in 'big data' external directories on the DeployR main server that are set up and managed by an administrator. These ‘big data’ directories can then be referenced by projects without the overhead of replicating the big data itself for each individual project. More...

Reinstalling Microsoft R Services or CRAN R

If you need to reinstall or upgrade Microsoft R Services, Revolution R Open, or R on the machine on which you are running DeployR, then learn more on how to ensure DeployR works after reinstalling. More...

 

Hadoop Impersonation & DeployR

Learn how to use Hadoop Impersonation to resolve proper file permissions when working with HDFS and DeployR. More...
